subtask.title: Define functional requirements and goals for AI chatbot integration
subtask.objective: Clarify specific functionalities needed from the chatbot, such as ticket creation, updates, or FAQs, and align with primary goal of faster resolution.
subtask.scope: Outline desired chatbot capabilities, scope of automation, and success metrics.

verification.completion_summary: The collected findings extensively discuss AI chatbot design principles, deployment strategies, and technical methods such as RAG, knowledge graphs, and Azure AI tools. However, they do not explicitly define specific functional requirements, detailed goals, or scope boundaries related to ticket creation, updates, FAQs, or direct alignment with resolution speed. The insights are broad and focus on best practices and technological considerations rather than concrete, measurable functional specifications.

covered_aspects: Emphasis on functional and context-aware AI design
Use of RAG and knowledge retrieval techniques relevant for FAQ and info retrieval
Integration via cloud tools like Azure AI
Proactive AI and workflow optimization concepts
Alignment with user needs and experience
missing_aspects: Explicit definitions of specific functionalities such as ticket creation, updates, and FAQs
Clear, measurable goals directly linking functionalities to faster resolution
Detailed scope boundaries outlining capabilities and automation limits
Explicit success metrics for evaluating chatbot performance

missing_requirements: Specific functional requirements for core tasks (ticket creation, status updates, FAQs)
Quantitative success metrics aligned with resolution speed
Prioritized feature list based on user interaction data
